Posts.Content: I was also a 7 although they had to do a saturation biopsy to find it. Had surgery about 14 months ago and so far so good. Keep your chin up and try to think positive,it can seem like a rollercoaster ride at times, but you will get through it. Good luck and best wishes.
Posts.Title: My Biopsy Results Are In

Posts.Content: I was also a 7 although they had to do a saturation biopsy to find it. Had surgery about 14 months ago and so far so good. Keep your chin up and try to think positive,it can seem like a rollercoaster ride at times, but you will get through it. Good luck and best wishes.
Posts.Title: My Biopsy Results Are In

Posts.Content: Congratulations are in order, my three month was in March and it was undectable. Doc said every six months for at least a year and we would look at it after that. I guess I am done worrying until October. Any ways congrats and I hope your number stay great.
Posts.Title: 3 month bloodwork

Posts.Content: I was also a 7 although they had to do a saturation biopsy to find it. Had surgery about 14 months ago and so far so good. Keep your chin up and try to think positive,it can seem like a rollercoaster ride at times, but you will get through it. Good luck and best wishes.

Posts.Content: I was also a 7 although they had to do a saturation biopsy to find it. Had surgery about 14 months ago and so far so good. Keep your chin up and try to think positive,it can seem like a rollercoaster ride at times, but you will get through it. Good luck and best wishes.

Posts.Content: Congratulations are in order, my three month was in March and it was undectable. Doc said every six months for at least a year and we would look at it after that. I guess I am done worrying until October. Any ways congrats and I hope your number stay great.
Posts.Title: 3 month bloodwork

Posts.Content: I agree with tpjames go see a URO. Most likely nothing major but it never hurts to check.
Posts.Title: Irregular urination

Posts.Content: I had two negative biopsies, a MRI , and a PCA3 test and they all indicated I did not have cancer. At the time my PSA was 24. The uro that did these test did not want to do anything else unless it went up ten points. I went to another URO six months later (as quick as I could get in) and he suggested a saturation biopsy, which I was all for. PSA ended up at 40. Saturation biopsy was about like the other two with the exception of being put under. I did/do ( first post surgery PSA is in March) have cancer G7, (3+4) in three of the 26 samples. I had been dealing with this for about two years and already decided I was going to have surgery if it cam to that. Surgery was 12/4/2017 and I could not be happier. Prostate was 67 grams and the doctor is pretty sure it was confined, not trying to be pessimistic but I would push for the saturation biopsy, I wished they had done mine about a year earlier. Good luck,it can be a long road with a lot of decisions , I truly wish you the best as I have been there and done that.
Posts.Title: High PSA and no cancer detected

Posts.Content: No sir the MRI did not show anything,and BCBS refused to pay for the PCA3 test which also indicated there was a 80% chance I did not have cancer. My journey has been a long one and I hope it is in my rear view mirror now. I was actually kinda relieved when they found it, in a strange sort of way. The last group I saw was Alliance Urology in Greensboro, North Carolina and they have been nothing short of great. Again good luck to you and I hope you get it figured out.
Posts.Title: High PSA and no cancer detected

Posts.Content: He may be dealing with the uncertainty of the future and he may be like I was a little teed off that I had it to start with. You really do feel alone and it is a lot to cope with.
Posts.Title: Brachytherapy + changes in husband

Posts.Content: Only thing I can add is do you trust your URO, if you do there should be no question as how to proceed. Good luck on whatever you decide.
Posts.Title: DRE to biopsy

Posts.Content: Only thing I can add is do you trust your URO, if you do there should be no question as how to proceed. Good luck on whatever you decide.
Posts.Title: DRE to biopsy

Posts.Content: Don't work for most like that,but congrats. My doc said not to even try Tull about a month after the Cath was removed. Looking back I really do not think he needed to tell me.
Posts.Title: Catheter out yesterday and sex today!

Posts.Content: Read and asked questions, keep your chin up, I made it through it on my on except for getting someone to drive me to the hospital and back. Surgery will be one year ago on 12/4. Good luck!
Posts.Title: All alone with no support

Posts.Content: Read and asked questions, keep your chin up, I made it through it on my on except for getting someone to drive me to the hospital and back. Surgery will be one year ago on 12/4. Good luck!
Posts.Title: All alone with no support

Posts.Content: Read and asked questions, keep your chin up, I made it through it on my on except for getting someone to drive me to the hospital and back. Surgery will be one year ago on 12/4. Good luck!
Posts.Title: All alone with no support

Posts.Content: Don't work for most like that,but congrats. My doc said not to even try Tull about a month after the Cath was removed. Looking back I really do not think he needed to tell me.
Posts.Title: Catheter out yesterday and sex today!

Posts.Content: Having gone through the surgery in December, there is no way I would take a chance on having to do it again down the road. Partial surgery was not a option for me but if it had been I would have opted to have it all removed. Once gone you do not have to worry about that surgery anymore. Just my 2 cents and good luck on what ever you decide on.
Posts.Title: My Story and decision time

Posts.Content: Having gone through the surgery in December, there is no way I would take a chance on having to do it again down the road. Partial surgery was not a option for me but if it had been I would have opted to have it all removed. Once gone you do not have to worry about that surgery anymore. Just my 2 cents and good luck on what ever you decide on.
Posts.Title: My Story and decision time

Posts.Content: Physical therapist told me last week to do kegels standing. She assured me that when I would leak. Surgery was yesterday 12/4/2017 and back home on 12/5/2017. Trying to get accustomed to the Cath. Been a hell of a ride so far.
Posts.Title: 2 weeks post RALP , 4 days post catheter

Posts.Content: Physical therapist told me last week to do kegels standing. She assured me that when I would leak. Surgery was yesterday 12/4/2017 and back home on 12/5/2017. Trying to get accustomed to the Cath. Been a hell of a ride so far.
Posts.Title: 2 weeks post RALP , 4 days post catheter

Posts.Content: It is a battle of nerves at times, good luck and keep your chin up. My surgery was in December and it is starting to feel like a bad dream at this point.
Posts.Title: nervously waiting for surgery

Posts.Content: Good luck and keep your chin up. Although something you would not want to make a habit of it is really not that bad.
Posts.Title: Tomorrow is the dayt

Posts.Content: Good luck and keep your chin up. Although something you would not want to make a habit of it is really not that bad.
Posts.Title: Tomorrow is the dayt

Posts.Content: It is a battle of nerves at times, good luck and keep your chin up. My surgery was in December and it is starting to feel like a bad dream at this point.
Posts.Title: nervously waiting for surgery

Posts.Content: I asked for a saturation after the third regular biopsy, doctor would not do it. Switched docs and after looking at everything that had been done he did a saturation. Other than be put under I did not think it was a bigger deal than the other three. They found the problem with it. In my opinion mine was worth it.
Posts.Title: Latest PSA - up again

Posts.Content: My friend and I both ended up with cancer, his psa was 9 and mine was a whooping 40. That being said each case is different so try not to worry and good luck.
Posts.Title: Additional MRI Images - so scared now

Posts.Content: I am a little over 4 months out and was dry within the second month during the night. I stopped using pads about two weeks b4 my three month follow up. I still have the occasional drop if I mis-step or lift something really heavy without thinking about it, but very minimal.
Posts.Title: Incontinence - is my situation odd?

Posts.Content: I am a little over 4 months out and was dry within the second month during the night. I stopped using pads about two weeks b4 my three month follow up. I still have the occasional drop if I mis-step or lift something really heavy without thinking about it, but very minimal.
Posts.Title: Incontinence - is my situation odd?

Posts.Content: First thing to do is relax and take a deep breath,let the doctors diagnose you before you go into full melt down. I know that all sorts of things run through your mind but you can not let it get the best of you. Best of luck.
Posts.Title: Additional MRI Images - so scared now

Posts.Content: Welcome to the forum and I am sorry you are here. Most of us have been where you are, and there is a lot of info to take in. The group of uros I used did a team approach thing. I met with a surgeon,radiologist, and a onocologist all in the same day before I chose which way to go. All were helpful and pretty much laid their thoughts on the line. Once you decide try not to second-guess yourself. Keep your chin up and good luck. I was also a G7 mine were all 3+4, and there were I think 4 positive out of 40. My last biopsy was a saturation and I was a little fuzzy when I talked to the doctor. Like I said good luck, and try not to let it get you down.
Posts.Title: New Member Confused by the numbers

Posts.Content: I never had any bleeding unless I was going to the bathroom. The only thing I was told was to watch out for clots. I hope he gets it under control, good luck.
Posts.Title: Bleeding after Biopsy

Posts.Content: I wished my psa had been as low as yours. A friend of mine had to go back for a second set of images, something screwed up on the first MRI , I had to do chest x-rays twice. Stay calm and try not to worry until there is something to worry about. I am sure your docs will get it worked out. Good luck and best wishes.
Posts.Title: Additional MRI Images - so scared now

Posts.Content: Good luck and good you get on top of it. Hope it works out for the best.
Posts.Title: Follow up on the rise in my PSA

Posts.Content: The doctor moved here from I think Texas and is a fairly young I would say mid forties. I have a couple of friends who are family docs and they speak very highly of him, the mri is going to be done in Greensboro,NC and he has mentioned Wesley Long Hospital which has a big cancer clinic. I am truly frustrated, but I have no symptoms of anything. Urine flow is normal,sleep all night,can go when I need to. When my family doc found the first psa of 19 he was positive that I most likely had cancer but he said it could be several things. I just wished they would find out. The urologist set up the mri today and it is 12/23 and my next appointment with him is 1/24. After I thought about it I called and told them to move the appointment up,the mri results will be back I would think no latter than the first week in January so I did not think I need to wait 3 additional weeks. The office said they would have him call with the results. I also made a appointment with another urologist Alliance Urology in Greensboro in febuary for another opinion. Both biopsies were 16 samples. I can live with the results but this is driving me a little crazy,kinda like being in the dark. Sorry if I am rambling but I am at my wits end here and really don't know what else to do. He said the mri would tell him if there were any areas that might be potentially a problem and he could zero the next biopsy to that area if that was the case. You would think with 32 samples even a blind hog finds a acorn now and again. I appreciate your response,I really don't anyone else to vent to. Just talking about it seems to help.
Posts.Title: Confused

Posts.Content: I am trying to keep my composure but there are times you just want to scream. Other than a hernia repair, I have never been in a hospital for anything major. I am scared to say the least and I think what scares me most is the feeling that I am not in any type of control. From what I had read when the first biopsy was negative I figured surely the second one would tell me something. You try not to worry but I have learned it is a task. The MRI I am set up for is just a MRI, haven't heard anything about a biopsy connected to it. The doc said it may help identify problem areas where he could concentrate another biopsy. I don't think he will be doing the third one. I like the guy but he is affiliated with a small hospital and I am sure I would be sent somewhere else for treatment. I really appreciate all the responses and I really think I can deal with the outcome,I just don't know when the end will be in sight. The hospital does have a portal but he never updates it, another frustrating fact.
Posts.Title: Confused

Posts.Content: Sounds very familiar to me,my PSA was 40 when they did my scans. Both are really a piece of cake,nothing at all to worry about.When they did my bone scan,I went in got injected and I think had to come back in two hours for the test. I had to have a saturation biopsy to find the cancer and I was a G7, four out of 26 cores. One 3+3, and three 3+4 . Good luck to you and keep your chin up.
Posts.Title: BONE and CAT Scan - what to except

Posts.Content: The doctor moved here from I think Texas and is a fairly young I would say mid forties. I have a couple of friends who are family docs and they speak very highly of him, the mri is going to be done in Greensboro,NC and he has mentioned Wesley Long Hospital which has a big cancer clinic. Both biopsies were 16 samples. I can live with the results but this is driving me a little crazy,kinda like being in the dark. Sorry if I am rambling but I am at my wits end here and really don't know what else to do. He said the mri would tell him if there were any areas that might be potentially a problem and he could zero the next biopsy to that area if that was the case. You would think with 32 samples even a blind hog finds a acorn now and again. I appreciate your response,I really don't anyone else to vent to. Just talking about it seems to help.
Posts.Title: Confused

Posts.Content: I had read a little on here when this journey started and I asked about the free psa and he did not order it so he said. I asked him several times after the first negative biopsy if there was anything else that needed to be done and we waited six more monyhs and did another blood test and another biopsy. That is the main reason I made appointments with another urologist group. Alliance is well known in my area and I figured I might as well go ahead with the mri and followup and then have my records transferred there. Thanks for all the responses.
Posts.Title: Confused

Posts.Content: Been dealing with this for almost a year and a half. I am 62 now and other than blood pressure take no other meds. During a routine physical about 18 months ago psa came in at 19. Regular doc referred me to a urologist in Eden,NC. He put me on Cipro for I think 30 days and did another PSA test. Same results ,a 19. He suggested we do a biopsy which I was very much inclined to agree with. He did a 16 core sample and it was negative. We go six months and do another blood test, this time it is 24. Another biopsy was done shortly after and it also came back negative. He is also doing DREs' and says everything feels normal. Well another six months has gone by and another PSA check. Had my appointment Tuesday and it is 27,another DRE and he says everything feels fine. So now he has ordered a MRI which I do on 12/23. I asked him at the last appointment if he thought I had cancer and his reply was he did not know, I am oddly looking at him trying to figure out what the 2 biopsies were for. Any body else ever had anything like this and if you don't mind how did it play out. I am worried and I have been for the last 18 months as soon as it went to 19 everybody decided I had cancer until the biopsies, and apparently now I don't know whether I do or not. Thanks in advance.
Posts.Title: Confused

Posts.Title: Confused

Posts.Content: Mine is sitting at 27,started at 19 then 24 and six months later I am where I am now. Two negative biopsies and I have a MRI on 12/29. Changing doctors on 1/24. I do not know what to think both biopsies were 16 samples, I am hoping for the best but preparing for the worst. Good luck with yours.
Posts.Title: Over treatment

Posts.Content: I was where you are on 12/4/2018 at Wesley Long Hospital in North Carolina. Now it seems like a bad dream and I am working my way back to normal or at least the way I was before. Don't know if I have ever been normal. My pain was minimal, cath wasn't much fun but only lasted a week. I was sore for about three weeks. Good luck,keep your chin up, hope everything works out great for you.
Posts.Title: 3 hours until no more prostate

Posts.Content: I listened to a talk radio program one night and the speaker was talking about marijuana killing cancer and how he had brought his psa down to nothing using what I think is hash oil suppositories. I mentioned it to my uro and he looked at me like I had two heads. I don't think he figured it would work, I thought maybe I could get a script, bit my state does not have medical marijuana yet.
Posts.Title: Is prostate cancer irreversible?

Posts.Content: I listened to a talk radio program one night and the speaker was talking about marijuana killing cancer and how he had brought his psa down to nothing using what I think is hash oil suppositories. I mentioned it to my uro and he looked at me like I had two heads. I don't think he figured it would work, I thought maybe I could get a script, bit my state does not have medical marijuana yet.
Posts.Title: Is prostate cancer irreversible?

Posts.Content: Right back to you and my fingers are crossed, due to find out in March.
Posts.Title: Happy New Year my Friends

Posts.Content: I am right behind you at 8 weeks out, things are pretty good with the incontinence and like you I think other things may be starting to come back to life, fingers crossed. Still have to think more than I used to about things like standing, taking odd steps and sneezing. Therapist said when you need to sneeze, you gotta squeeze. I will never forget my anxiety but I am kinda laid back about it now. PSA the end of March , I will be glad when that is done. I have zero regrets about my choices and am trying to take it one day at a time.
Posts.Title: 10 weeks post surgery

Posts.Content: I am right behind you at 8 weeks out, things are pretty good with the incontinence and like you I think other things may be starting to come back to life, fingers crossed. Still have to think more than I used to about things like standing, taking odd steps and sneezing. Therapist said when you need to sneeze, you gotta squeeze. I will never forget my anxiety but I am kinda laid back about it now. PSA the end of March , I will be glad when that is done. I have zero regrets about my choices and am trying to take it one day at a time.
Posts.Title: 10 weeks post surgery

Posts.Content: On this site a lot of us have been where you are right now. I had all the same emotions including being pissed off. Try to stay calm and get all your facts before going into total meltdown( like I did ). Many good people o her to help you along the way, main thing I found out is to keep your chin up and try and be as positive as you can. Good luck and it helps to talk.
Posts.Title: First Post - Shock, Fear, Confusion

Posts.Content: Good luck and it won't be too long it will seem like a bad dream. I hope he does great and gets nothing but great reports. Everyone is correct the Cath is worrisome but I never had any pain, some mild discomfort a couple of times. It was like being released from prison when it came out.
Posts.Title: 2 days post op

Posts.Content: On this site a lot of us have been where you are right now. I had all the same emotions including being pissed off. Try to stay calm and get all your facts before going into total meltdown( like I did ). Many good people o her to help you along the way, main thing I found out is to keep your chin up and try and be as positive as you can. Good luck and it helps to talk.
Posts.Title: First Post - Shock, Fear, Confusion

Posts.Content: Sounds like congratulations are in order.
Posts.Title: 18 Month Milestone

Posts.Content: Good luck.I had a total of three before they found it. Two regular biopsies and the last was a saturation, never had any major problems but I am glad I don't have to get anymore.
Posts.Title: Heading for a second biopsy maybe?

Posts.Content: On this site a lot of us have been where you are right now. I had all the same emotions including being pissed off. Try to stay calm and get all your facts before going into total meltdown( like I did ). Many good people o her to help you along the way, main thing I found out is to keep your chin up and try and be as positive as you can. Good luck and it helps to talk.
Posts.Title: First Post - Shock, Fear, Confusion

Posts.Content: I was on a farm tractor bush-hogging some fairly rough sections of the farm about 9 weeks after surgery. Was a little sore (all over) from doing pretty much nothing physical for 6 weeks but other than that no problems. Don't know if that helps.
Posts.Title: Experiences of motorcyclists who have had prostate surgery?

Posts.Content: Good luck and it won't be too long it will seem like a bad dream. I hope he does great and gets nothing but great reports. Everyone is correct the Cath is worrisome but I never had any pain, some mild discomfort a couple of times. It was like being released from prison when it came out.
Posts.Title: 2 days post op

Posts.Content: Filled my bladder also and wanted me to stop it on midstream if I could. The first two to three days were the worst for me. Saw a huge difference in about 30 days. Good luck and it was painless.
Posts.Title: Catheter removal preparations

Posts.Content: A lot of things can cause elevation, I would definitely keep a check on it. My uro says no weight training, sex, or bike riding within in three days of the test.
Posts.Title: Elevated PSA normal DRE

Posts.Content: From my understanding psa should not be taken immediately following a dre. The two urologist I saw did a round of antibiotics , thirty days before another PSA was done. The reason for two rounds was that I fired the first uro. Good luck , mine was quite a bit higher than your number, but I would stay on top of it.
Posts.Title: Elevated PSA normal DRE

Posts.Content: It has been a long road and after 2.5 years and after several biopsies including a saturation followed by surgery on 12/4/2017 my doctor told me today I was cancer free. I have really been stressed about this test,more than any I have ever taken, I was on the verge of tears when he told me. This has been one of the worst things I have ever dealt with and it seemed it was always hurry up and wait. It has not really sunk in that at this point I have my health back and with any luck it will stay that way. This forum has been a life saver and I don't know what I would have done without it. It has gotten me through a lot of dark times. I would like to say thanks to everyone on here.
Posts.Title: First blood test since surgery

Posts.Content: My uro advised not to rush it, recovery could take anywhere from six to 18 months. He explained they try and get the cancer gone first, continence second and sexual function normally comes in last. As stated take what you read with a grain of salt about sexual recovery. From what I have read he may want to try Cialis , some say it works better for them than viagra. Good luck and I am sure everything will be back to normal before long.
Posts.Title: Post RALP ED questions.

Posts.Content: I went with Tena, I was just a little more comfortable with them.
Posts.Title: Incontinence pad experience

Posts.Content: That was the strangest feeling I had and I woke up telling the nurses I had to go. Took me a couple of days to get past it. Glad you are doing ok.
Posts.Title: RALP complete / Onto the other side.

Posts.Content: I am 63.5 and have high blood pressure. They had no problem doing mine. Good luck and I would get a second opinion.
Posts.Title: ocman

Posts.Content: I have read everything from marijuana extract to castor oil. I talked with my uro about some of the things I had read and he smiled and looked at me like I had two heads. Eneded up doing surgery,figured it was my best be.
Posts.Title: ocman

Posts.Content: That was the strangest feeling I had and I woke up telling the nurses I had to go. Took me a couple of days to get past it. Glad you are doing ok.
Posts.Title: RALP complete / Onto the other side.

Posts.Content: Sorry you are here, but you be assured most of us are or have been right where you are at. Everyone has different opinions about options, do your research asked any questions you might have, even the ones you may think are silly. Pick your posion and don't look back. Good luck to you and I hope you get it figures out .
Posts.Title: Newbie

Posts.Content: We have similar stories,mine went on for about two years. My PSA started at 19, went to 24 and finally forty. During the time I had three regular biopsies and the last one was a saturation I think he took 28 samples. The first thing I had to do was come to terms with myself. Once I calmed down , I realized you have to play the hand you are dealt. I was scared,super anxious, and pissed off that this had happened to me. I found a lot of solace on this forum,cause people that have not dealt with it really don't have a clue. It ended up that I had cancer, G7 and my numbers seemed to be a bit confusing at least to me. The saturation biopsy revealed 4 positive samples 1-3+3 and 3-3+4. I had surgery on 12/4 and do not have another PSA test till March. Try and stay calm read and learn as much as you can, during the bad times and there will be some, get on here and talk to people. I did not realize how many people that I knew that had been through this, there are a lot out there. As stated I realized I had too roll with it cause when it first started I did not have any control over it. There are a lot of treatments and a lot of options out there, keep your chin up and good luck for the best outcome.
Posts.Title: Psa 40 and scared

Posts.Content: Really did not care my surgeon is male,his PA female,and the nicest therapist I have ever met female. I have nothing but good things to say about all of them, they saved my life.
Posts.Title: What's your thoughts on a female doing the DRE exam

Posts.Content: Soon it will seem like a bad dream. Take it easy and do what the doc tells you to do,walking really does help.
Posts.Title: One Day Post-op

Posts.Content: I had one back in October,it was not bad. It was a indo rectal and other than minor discomfort mainly fromthe sound it was not bad. They are loud,and I mean loud.I think it lasted about 20 minutes and it was just a memory after that, Good luck and I am sure you will do fine.
Posts.Title: Prostate MRI on Friday

Posts.Content: Have not posted in a while,this has been a on going thing for about 2 years. . I am 62 years old. My PSA two years ago went from 3.9 to 19. Urologist did the 30 days of antibiotics followed by another test which was still 19. He did a 12 core biopsy that was negative. 6 months pass and PSA was 24, another biopsy also negative. Suggested a mri which was done and was told it was normal. I decided to change doctors and started going to Alliance Urology in Greensboro,NC. He did a PCA3 test which came in at a 20 and another blood test. PSA came back at 40 and he suggested a saturation biopsy which was done on 9/12/2017. He did a 26 core sample. Got the call today,out of the 26 one was 3 plus 3, and two were 4 plus 3. . He says it needed to be treated and I have a consult set for 9/27/2017. Thanks to everyone for answering all the questions I had. I guess this will start chapter 2.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed

Posts.Content: I have been leaning towards surgery since the prospect of this started.The urologist said this morning I could be a candidate for radiation and we would discuss options on the 27th. He seems to be pretty straight up but it is a lot to digest. All I can do is hope I make the right choices.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed

Posts.Content: Really did not care my surgeon is male,his PA female,and the nicest therapist I have ever met female. I have nothing but good things to say about all of them, they saved my life.
Posts.Title: What's your thoughts on a female doing the DRE exam

Posts.Content: Really did not care my surgeon is male,his PA female,and the nicest therapist I have ever met female. I have nothing but good things to say about all of them, they saved my life.
Posts.Title: What's your thoughts on a female doing the DRE exam

Posts.Content: Hang tough and keep your chin up. Mine was done on 12/4 and the cath was out on 12/12. Although it is not a cakewalk, it is not that bad. I took nothing but tylenol and slept in my bed from night one after getting home. You gonna be sore but mine started tapering quickly after the third day. You will be on the other side of this before you know it. Good luck and keep looking forward.
Posts.Title: Merry Christmas, RALP now 4 days away

Posts.Content: Hang tough and keep your chin up. Mine was done on 12/4 and the cath was out on 12/12. Although it is not a cakewalk, it is not that bad. I took nothing but tylenol and slept in my bed from night one after getting home. You gonna be sore but mine started tapering quickly after the third day. You will be on the other side of this before you know it. Good luck and keep looking forward.
Posts.Title: Merry Christmas, RALP now 4 days away

Posts.Content: I had three regular biopsies and the fourth was a saturation before they found mine. The MRI was normal but my PSA was 40 when I finally got diagnosed . Good luck and I hope you have a great outcome.
Posts.Title: Question Please----PSA-----

Posts.Content: I wore a pull up home after the cath was removed but it was crazy hot,this was in December, I could not deal with the sweating so I switched to tena medium protection pads. Used them for about 9 weeks. I was lucky I guess as I was dry at night right off the bat. Could have probably stopped before nine weeks but I was extra cautious and self conscience about it. Doctor finally told me to stop using them. Still have to think about it before I do anything strenuous.
Posts.Title: What type of pad to use after catheter removal

Posts.Content: I am by no means a expert but I was a 3+4 also and what you are describing sounds like the same thing I went through. Took several weeks before I slept all night. My surgery was 12/4/2017 and I am happy to say I have been dry for several months. My sex life still has a ways to go but it is improving, the pills do help. Good luck and keep your chin up it will get better.
Posts.Title: 15 day Post-RALP report

Posts.Content: I had one back in October,it was not bad. It was a indo rectal and other than minor discomfort mainly fromthe sound it was not bad. They are loud,and I mean loud.I think it lasted about 20 minutes and it was just a memory after that, Good luck and I am sure you will do fine.
Posts.Title: Prostate MRI on Friday

Posts.Content: I also had three in about 2.5 years, the last one I had was a saturation biopsy and that's when they found the cancer. My psa was quite a bit higher than yours, but I think I am doing pretty good now. Once it was found and after to talking to all the doctors I had surgery 12/4. Was a long journey but fingers crossed I may have gotten lucky. Good luck to you and I hope you get good reports.
Posts.Title: Prostate MRI on Friday

Posts.Content: Soon it will seem like a bad dream. Take it easy and do what the doc tells you to do,walking really does help.
Posts.Title: One Day Post-op

Posts.Content: Mine may have been a hour,all a little fuzzy so much has taken place since then.
Posts.Title: Prostate MRI on Friday

Posts.Content: Mine may have been a hour,all a little fuzzy so much has taken place since then.
Posts.Title: Prostate MRI on Friday

Posts.Content: I also had three in about 2.5 years, the last one I had was a saturation biopsy and that's when they found the cancer. My psa was quite a bit higher than yours, but I think I am doing pretty good now. Once it was found and after to talking to all the doctors I had surgery 12/4. Was a long journey but fingers crossed I may have gotten lucky. Good luck to you and I hope you get good reports.
Posts.Title: Prostate MRI on Friday

Posts.Content: Congrats it will all seem like a bad dream in the near future. I walked as much as I could before and after the surgery,it does help. You will feel like a different person when the cath comes out.
Posts.Title: Two days post op

Posts.Content: Good luck on a great report, you should feel like a new man with the cath gone.
Posts.Title: 6 days RALP catheter out minimal leakage

Posts.Content: The first biopsy I had my urine was like blood for about a week. The second one was not as bad. The third was a saturation biopsy and I figured it would be terrible as so many samples were taken. Urine was a brownish color but cleared in about three days. I did not have any problems but I did eat a soft diet on all three for several days. My last biopsy was in the middle of September and my surgery was the fourth of December. The only thing they ever told me in regards to the biopsies was to take it easy for several days and watch for major clots being passed or a tempature. Sorry he is having problems,tell him to keep his chin up.
Posts.Title: Healthy Prostate gland???

Posts.Content: I think the standard procedure when a high PSA is found and the Doctor does a DRE and everything feels normal is a course of antibiotics. I was on Cipro for 30 days and had another PSA test two weeks after. The cipro was making me feel pretty bad by the end of it but my PSA (19) remained the same. He did a biopsy about two weeks later and it was negative. Went back 6 months later and PSA was at 24 and another biopsy also negative. Another blood test on 12/13/2016 and the PSA was 27 after this he ordered the MRI. I wished I had found this site early on,te guys on here have some great info and do not hesitate to share. I am sure someone will be along shortly to add to this. If there is anyway he will talk to you about his situation he needs to get in front of this and if his doctor is like the one I started off with he may need to find another one. He may have wanted him to wait to let the entire course of the antibiotic run it's course, don't know about that one but if I were him I would be asking the doctor. I truly hope everything works out for him this stuff can really play with your mind.
Posts.Title: Question from New User about my boyfriend's high PSA score

Posts.Content: I think the standard procedure when a high PSA is found and the Doctor does a DRE and everything feels normal is a course of antibiotics. I was on Cipro for 30 days and had another PSA test two weeks after. The cipro was making me feel pretty bad by the end of it but my PSA (19) remained the same. Posts.Title: Question from New User about my boyfriend's high PSA score

Posts.Content: I was depressed and mad both, the only thing you can do is keep your chin up and sail on. I do not think there is a easy answer. I know it is hard but you have to trudge through . My neighbor is a pastor and although I am not overly religious, he helped me a lot. O wish you the best and try to stay calm.no
Posts.Title: Depression after RP

Posts.Content: I was depressed and mad both, the only thing you can do is keep your chin up and sail on. I do not think there is a easy answer. I know it is hard but you have to trudge through . My neighbor is a pastor and although I am not overly religious, he helped me a lot. O wish you the best and try to stay calm.no

Posts.Content: I was depressed and mad both, the only thing you can do is keep your chin up and sail on. I do not think there is a easy answer. I know it is hard but you have to trudge through . My neighbor is a pastor and although I am not overly religious, he helped me a lot. O wish you the best and try to stay calm.no
Posts.Title: Depression after RP

Posts.Content: My uro said he did not like to do the first psa till 90 days after surgery. My srgery was 12/4/2017 and the first psa was March. Hope that helps.
Posts.Title: Any good studies on how long it takes for PSA to return to baseline post prostate bx?

Posts.Content: I spoke with a relative this afternoon, and he said just the person I wanted to talk to. He had his first PSA test a couple of weeks ago, his doctor, a internist also did a DRE. The doctor told him the gland may be a little enlarged but other than that felt normal. His PSA came back at 140 and he is concerned to say the least. Trust me, I know the feeling. It seems to me a bone scan at this point is putting the cart in front of the horse since he has not been diagnosed. I advised him to have the doctor refer him to a uro, since I figure that is where it will wind up anyway. I also told him about this site. I had surgery about 14 months ago and really do not know what else to say at this point. The PSA is a monster but it could be something other than cancer. I had several biopsies before mine was found. My bone scans and MRI were after the dx. Any other suggestions that I could tell him would be appreciated,all you guys were a big help when I went through and I would like to pay it forward.
Posts.Title: Concerned

Posts.Content: Sorry he is 67 .
Posts.Title: Concerned

Posts.Content: I think the doctor is new to him,as to why this is the first test,don't know. He has been on flomax due to getting up during the night. I told him it could be something other than cancer and asked about antobiotics. She did not put him on anything ,just set up a bone scan.I took thirty days worth before the first biopsy. I really don't know what to tell him other that get a good uro.
Posts.Title: Concerned

Posts.Content: That great,wished I could say the same. The first week after the cath was pretty bad,I am in my 3rd week without it and I can see a huge difference,two pads a day and totally dry at night. congrats on your sucess,and good luck.
Posts.Title: Surgical pathology / catheter removal

Posts.Content: My uro said he did not like to do the first psa till 90 days after surgery. My srgery was 12/4/2017 and the first psa was March. Hope that helps.
Posts.Title: Any good studies on how long it takes for PSA to return to baseline post prostate bx?

Posts.Content: If I were you I would be excited and looking forward to the healing process. It took me several weeks before I was dry at night but it was a great feeling when it happened, only used one pull up and went to Tena pads after that. Sounds like you are on the right path to me, good luck and I hope you keep doing great.
Posts.Title: Goodbye, Foley!

Posts.Content: As stated that was his first psa,so that is the history.
Posts.Title: Concerned

Posts.Content: Only thing I can add is being pissed off as why this happened to me. Once I realized you play the hand you are dealt , I calmed down and set forth making choices on how to get rid of it. My journey was about three years and had plenty of ups,downs, and I don't knows'. Will find out in March what the trail is in the future, trying not to worry and recover from the surgery is at the top of my list now.
Posts.Title: Reflection on my cancer journey as I enter the treatment phase.

Posts.Content: If I were you I would be excited and looking forward to the healing process. It took me several weeks before I was dry at night but it was a great feeling when it happened, only used one pull up and went to Tena pads after that. Sounds like you are on the right path to me, good luck and I hope you keep doing great.

Posts.Title: Goodbye, Foley!

Posts.Content: I had three, the first two took seven days, and the last one was a different doctor and the results were back in 4 days.
Posts.Title: Shortest and longest time people had to wait get biopsy results?

Posts.Content: I had three, the first two took seven days, and the last one was a different doctor and the results were back in 4 days.
Posts.Title: Shortest and longest time people had to wait get biopsy results?

Posts.Content: Good luck and smooth sailing.
Posts.Title: Appointment with Robot tomorrow

Posts.Content: Good luck and smooth sailing.
Posts.Title: Appointment with Robot tomorrow

Posts.Content: Biopsied a G7, finally after 3 regular and a fourth saturation biopsy. I went with robotic surgery after to talking to all the docs. I wanted it gone and if need be a second bite at the apple. Won't know till March whether I need that bite or not. Surgery was not something I would want to do every year, but there wasn't much pain. There was a lot of soreness which started leaving quickly after the third day. Looking back now it has been like a bad dream, and I hope and pray it is over. I guess each person has to make their own decisions, so far I have no regrets with mine.
